subject: Home & DIY
title: The Rocking Chair's American Story
description: A short lesson to help you apply The Rocking Chair's American Story.

hook.text: Benjamin Franklin is often credited with inventing the rocking chair. He didn'tâ€”but he made it famous.

buildup.text: Rocking chairs appeared in North America around 1710, likely created by adding curved rails to existing garden chairs.

discovery.text: The rocking motion mimics being held and swayed. Studies show it reduces anxiety, lowers blood pressure, and aids sleep.

twist.text: Presidents from Lincoln to Kennedy were famous rockers. JFK's doctor prescribed rocking for his chronic back pain.

climax.text: Sam Maloof's handcrafted rockers sell for $80,000+. The humble rocking chair became fine art.

punchline.text: A porch chair became a presidential tradition.

quiz.question: Why did President Kennedy famously use a rocking chair?
options: His doctor prescribed it for chronic back pain
It was a family heirloom from the Kennedy estate
It was a gift from a foreign diplomat
